Jalur Pendakian Gunung Rinjani Dibuka Lagi Besok
05 Nov 2019, 12:29 by Antara, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Balai Taman Nasional Gunung Rinjani (BTNGR) kembali membuka jalur pendakian Gunung Rinjani di Pulau Lombok, Nusa Tenggara Barat mulai Rabu, 6 November 2019 setelah sebelumnya ditutup akibat kebakaran hutan yang terjadi sejak 19 Oktober 2019.
"Pembukaan jalur pendakian tersebut berdasarkan kesepakatan bersama dengan berbagai pihak dalam rapat pembahasan mengenai hasil survei jalur pendakian pascakebakaran hutan," Kepala BTNGR Dedy Asriady, seusai memimpin rapat di Mataram, Selasa.
Rapat tersebut diikuti oleh BTNGR, BMKG, Badan Penanggulangan Bencana Daerah NTB, perwakilan Dinas Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral NTB, Dinas Pekerjaan Umum NTB, Dinas Pariwisata Kabupaten Lombok Utara, Lombok Timur, dan Lombok Tengah, perwakilan trekking organizer dan pemandu wisata gunung (porter dan guide), serta lembaga pemerhati lingkungan Blue Green Indonesia.
Dedy menyebutkan empat jalur pendakian resmi yang kembali dibuka adalah pintu pendakian Senaru di Kabupaten Lombok Utara, Aik Berik di Kabupaten Lombok Tengah, Sembalun dan Timbanuh di Kabupaten Lombok Timur.
"Dengan kembali dibukanya empat jalur pendakian tersebut, maka BTNGR mencabut surat keputusan penutupan sementara jalur pendakian akibat adanya kebakaran hutan di Taman Nasional Gunung Rinjani yang diterbitkan pada 20 Oktober 2019," ujarnya.
Ia mengatakan meskipun jalur pendakian kembali dibuka, namun aktivitas pengunjung tetap dibatasi hanya sampai Pelawangan, dan tidak diperbolehkan sampai ke Danau Segara Anak, dan puncak gunung.
Hal itu berdasarkan hasil survei bahwa kondisi jalur pendakian yang dinyatakan aman hanya sampai di Pelawangan, sedangkan ke danau dan puncak gunung masih dalam kategori berbahaya bagi keselamatan pengunjung.
Dedy menambahkan di jalur pendakian menuju Danau Segara Anak dan puncak gunung masih terdapat potensi longsor sebagai dampak dari gempa bumi yang terjadi pada 2018.
"Di jalur Pelawangan Sembalun menuju puncak gunung terdapat tiga titik berbahaya, dan ada kondisi longsor sepanjang 20 meter di jalur menuju danau. Begitu juga jalur Danau Segara Anak-Torean, kondisi tanahnya labil," ujarnya.
Dalam rapat pembahasan hasil survei jalur pendakian tersebut, para TO dan pemandu wisata gunung juga sepakat untuk memastikan pelayanan yang aman, nyaman dan bertanggung jawab kepada para pengunjung sesuai dengan standar operasional prosedur pendakian.
Semua pihak terkait juga sepakat untuk mendata dan membina serta mengevaluasi kegiatan pendakian ilegal yang tidak sesuai dengan peraturan yang berlaku.
BTNGR juga akan melakukan koordinasi dengan Pemerintah Provinsi NTB, Pemerintah Kabupaten Lombok Utara, Lombok Timur, dan Lombok Tengah, untuk perencanaan perbaikan dan rekonstruksi jalur pendakian Rinjani.

Mount Rinjani Climbing Path Open Again Tomorrow
05 Nov 2019, 12:29 by Antara, Yudono Yanuar
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Mount Rinjani National Park Office (BTNGR) has re-opened Mt. Rinjani hiking trail on Lombok Island, West Nusa Tenggara starting Wednesday, November 6, 2019 after it was previously closed due to forest fires that occurred on October 19, 2019.
"The opening of the hiking trail is based on mutual agreement with various parties in a discussion meeting on the results of a survey of the post-fire hiking trail," BTNGR Head Dedy Asriady, after chairing a meeting in Mataram, Tuesday.
The meeting was attended by BTNGR, BMKG, the NTB Regional Disaster Management Agency, representatives of the NTB Department of Energy and Mineral Resources, the NTB Public Works Department, the North Lombok Regency, East Lombok and Central Lombok District Tourism Officers, trekking organizer representatives and mountain tour guides (porters and guide), and the Blue Green Indonesia environmental watchdog.
Dedy said that the four official climbing routes that were reopened were the Senaru climbing gate in North Lombok Regency, Aik Berik in Central Lombok Regency, Sembalun and Timbanuh in East Lombok Regency.
"With the reopening of the four hiking routes, BTNGR revoked the temporary closure of the hiking trail due to forest fires in the Mount Rinjani National Park which was published on October 20, 2019," he said.
He said although the hiking trail was reopened, visitor activity remained limited to Pelawangan, and was not allowed to reach Lake Segara Anak, and the top of the mountain.
This was based on the survey results that the condition of the hiking trail which was declared safe only reached Pelawangan, while the lake and the top of the mountain were still in the dangerous category for the safety of visitors.
Dedy added that on the hiking trail to Lake Segara Anak and the peak of the mountain there are still potential landslides as a result of the earthquake that occurred in 2018.
"On the Pelawangan Sembalun route to the top of the mountain there are three dangerous points, and there are landslide conditions along the 20 meters in the path to the lake. Likewise the Segara Anak-Torean Lake route, the soil conditions are unstable," he said.
In the discussion meeting of the results of the hiking trail survey, the TO and mountain tour guides also agreed to ensure safe, comfortable and responsible services to visitors in accordance with the standard operating procedures of the climb.
All related parties also agreed to record and develop and evaluate illegal climbing activities that are not in accordance with applicable regulations.
BTNGR will also coordinate with the NTB Provincial Government, the District Governments of North Lombok, East Lombok and Central Lombok, for planning improvements and reconstruction of the Rinjani hiking trail.
